Pre-Game Insights: Australia will be on wafer-thin ice if they lose, while India has a decent safety net but could still lose out on a semi-finals slot.
Conditions in St Lucia are expected to be favorable for batting, with a good chance of rain in the morning.
India has a 3-2 edge over Australia in their T20 World Cup meetings so far.
Virat Kohli (4103) and Rohit Sharma (4073) are separated by just 30 runs on top of India's run-scoring leaderboard in T20Is.
If both feature, Agar and Arshdeep will play their 50th T20Is. Agar made his T20I debut in March 2016, while Arshdeep made his in July 2022.
Offspinners have bowled effectively to Kohli and Rohit in the powerplay so far at this World Cup, with Mohammad Nabi and Mahedi Hasan getting through quiet overs.
